This class serves as both extension definition and configuration. Operations are based on the standard BaseFileSystemOperations

operation.name: copy
operation.description:
Copies the file at the sourcePath into the targetPath.

If targetPath doesn't exist, and neither does its parent, then an attempt will be made to create depending on the value of the createParentFolder argument. If such argument is , then a FILE:ILLEGAL_PATH will be thrown.

If the target file already exists, then it will be overwritten if the overwrite argument is true. Otherwise, FILE:FILE_ALREADY_EXISTS error will be thrown.

As for the sourcePath, it can either be a file or a directory. If it points to a directory, then it will be copied recursively.

If targetPath doesn't exist, and neither does its parent, then an attempt will be made to create depending on the value of the createParentFolder argument. If such argument is , then a FILE:ILLEGAL_PATH will be thrown.

If the target file already exists, then it will be overwritten if the overwrite argument is true. Otherwise, FILE:FILE_ALREADY_EXISTS error will be thrown.

As for the sourcePath, it can either be a file or a directory. If it points to a directory, then it will be moved recursively.

operation.name: read
operation.description:
Obtains the content and metadata of a file at a given path. The operation itself returns a Message which payload is a InputStream with the file's content, and the metadata is represent as a LocalFileAttributes object that's placed as the message Message#getAttributes() attributes.

If the lock parameter is set to true, then a file system level lock will be placed on the file until the input stream this operation returns is closed or fully consumed. Because the lock is actually provided by the host file system, its behavior might change depending on the mounted drive and the operation system on which mule is running. Take that into consideration before blindly relying on this lock.

This method also makes a best effort to determine the mime type of the file being read. The file's extension will be used to make an educated guess on the file's mime type. The user also has the chance to force the output encoding and mimeType through the outputEncoding and outputMimeType optional parameters.

parameter.name: path
parameter.description: the path to the file to be read

parameter.name: lock
parameter.description: whether or not to lock the file. Defaults to false.

parameter.name: timeBetweenSizeCheck
parameter.description: wait time between size checks to determine if a file is ready to be read.

parameter.name: timeBetweenSizeCheckUnit
parameter.description: time unit to be used in the wait time between size checks.

parameter.name: outputMimeType
parameter.description: The mime type of the payload that this operation outputs.

parameter.name: outputEncoding
parameter.description: The encoding of the payload that this operation outputs.

parameter.name: streamingStrategy
parameter.description: Configure if repeatable streams should be used and their behaviour

parameter.name: target
parameter.description: The name of a variable on which the operation's output will be placed

parameter.name: targetValue
parameter.description: An expression that will be evaluated against the operation's output and the outcome of that expression will be stored in the target variable

operation.name: write
operation.description:
Writes the content into the file pointed by path.

If the directory on which the file is attempting to be written doesn't exist, then the operation will either throw FILE:ILLEGAL_PATH error or create such folder depending on the value of the createParentDirectory.

If the file itself already exists, then the behavior depends on the supplied mode.

This operation also supports locking support depending on the value of the lock argument, but following the same rules and considerations as described in the read operation.

parameter.name: lock

parameter.description: a FileWriteMode. Defaults to OVERWRITE

parameter.name: reconnectionStrategy
parameter.description: A retry strategy in case of connectivity errors

source.name: listener
source.description:
Polls a directory looking for files that have been created or updated. One message will be generated for each file that is found.

The key part of this functionality is how to determine that a file is actually new. There're three strategies for that:

  • Set the autoDelete parameter to true: This will delete each processed file after it has been processed, causing all files obtained in the next poll to be necessarily new
  • Set moveToDirectory parameter: This will move each processed file to a different directory after it has been processed, achieving the same effect as autoDelete but without loosing the file
  • Use the watermarkMode parameter to only pick files that have been created/updated after the last poll was executed.

A matcher can also be used for additional filtering of files.

parameter.name: directory
parameter.description: The directory on which polled files are contained

parameter.name: recursive
parameter.description: Whether or not to also files contained in sub directories.

parameter.name: matcher
parameter.description: A matcher used to filter events on files which do not meet the matcher's criteria

parameter.name: watermarkMode
parameter.description: Controls whether or not to do watermarking, and if so, if the watermark should consider the file's modification or creation timestamps

parameter.name: timeBetweenSizeCheck
parameter.description: Wait time in milliseconds between size checks to determine if a file is ready to be read. This allows a file write to complete before processing. You can disable this feature by omitting a value. When enabled, Mule performs two size checks waiting the specified time between calls. If both checks return the same value, the file is ready to be read.

parameter.name: timeBetweenSizeCheckUnit
parameter.description: A TimeUnit which qualifies the #timeBetweenSizeCheck attribute.

parameter.name: primaryNodeOnly
parameter.description: Whether this source should only be executed on the primary node when runnning in Cluster

parameter.name: schedulingStrategy
parameter.description: Configures the scheduler that triggers the polling

parameter.name: redeliveryPolicy
parameter.description: Defines a policy for processing the redelivery of the same message

parameter.name: reconnectionStrategy
parameter.description: A retry strategy in case of connectivity errors

parameter.name: autoDelete
parameter.description: Whether each file should be deleted after processing or not

parameter.name: moveToDirectory
parameter.description: If provided, each processed file will be moved to a directory pointed by this path.

parameter.name: renameTo
parameter.description: This parameter works in tandem with moveToDirectory. Use this parameter to enter the name under which the file should be moved. Do not set this parameter if moveToDirectory hasn't been set as well.

parameter.name: applyPostActionWhenFailed
parameter.description: Whether any of the post actions (autoDelete and moveToDirectory) should also be applied in case the file failed to be processed. If set to false, no failed files will be moved nor deleted.
